basics.name: Amberley Romo
basics.label: Software Engineer
basics.summary: My ancestry traces back to a Spanish warlord. I’m an avid knitter and yogi. I’ve learned and forgotten conversational Mandarin. I have the softest pet rabbit -- who may or may not have his own Instagram.

work.summary: Social Driver is a DC-based agency that integrates strategy, creative, and technology to drive results for clients.
highlights: Managed software/ web development projects ($40k - $100k), primarily in the realm of data visualization.
Served as primary liaison between clients and the production team, translating technical concepts into non-technical terms, and client needs into project priorities.
Scoped and crafted responses to RFPs, expanded existing accounts and engaged new business.

work.company: The Arc of the United States
work.summary: The Arc is the largest national community-based organization advocating for and serving people with intellectual and developmental disabilities and their families.
highlights: Designed and built new sites, and maintained existing sites and content using BlackBaud NetCommunity and WordPress, executed and tracked email marketing campaigns, and built organizational social media strategy.

work.company: The Arc of the United States
highlights: Implemented the national rebranding of a top nonprofit by coordinating the brand licensing of (and overall adoption by) 300+ affiliates, and provided ongoing support of their individual implementation needs.

projects.name: Vitamin DB
highlights: Architected back-end using Node.js, Express and Postgres/Knex, emphasizing a test-driven development approach based on a Chai and Mocha testing suite, with Supertest to streamline server testing.
Designed overall user experience and executed polished styling based on React-Bootstrap.
Created automatic email notification on user signup, and implemented automated build testing w/ Travis CI.

projects.name: CinemaPlate
projects.summary: Provides a random movie (Netflix) and delivery (Eat24) pairing based on a user’s location.
highlights: Led team in devising and prioritizing feature enhancements to a legacy project, executed front-end improvements, and successfully deployed app to Heroku platform.

projects.name: Travel Consensus
projects.summary: Facilitates communication and consensus-building around group travel planning.
highlights: Used React.js to construct full front-end view structure,  designed to handle data prior to integrating with back-end, and designed overall user experience.
Led team in idea generation, selection and ultimately refinement of product concept.

projects.name: Beltway Focus
projects.summary: Visualizes the frequency of a searched word or phrase appearing in the Congressional Record.
highlights: Used d3.js to translate data retrieved from public API to reveal compelling trends.
